doc:
Judson Laire https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Judson_Laire 0 Judson Laire (Manhattan, New York City, August 3, 1902 – Rhinebeck, New York, July 5, 1979) was an American film, stage, and television actor best known for starring as Lars Hansen in the early CBS television series, Mama from 1949 to 1957, as well as several daytime soap operas including As the World Turns, The Nurses, Love is a Many Splendored Thing and The Edge Of Night.In a thirty-year stage career Laire appeared in ten Broadway productions. A resident of Clinton Corners, New York, he died at Northern Dutchess Hospital in Rhinebeck, New York, in 1979 at 76. Among his Broadway credits was Advise and Consent by Loring Mandel which opened in 1961. Judson_Laire ( Manhattan , New_York_City , August_3_,_1902 – Rhinebeck , New_York , July_5_,_1979 ) was an_American_film , stage , and television_actor best_known for starring as Lars_Hansen in the_early_CBS_television_series , Mama from 1949 to 1957 , as_well_as several_daytime_soap_operas including As the_World Turns , The_Nurses , Love is a_Many_Splendored_Thing and The_Edge Of Night.In a_thirty-year_stage_career_Laire appeared in ten_Broadway_productions . A_resident of Clinton_Corners , New_York , he died at Northern_Dutchess_Hospital in Rhinebeck , New_York , in 1979 at 76 . Among his_Broadway_credits was Advise_and_Consent by Loring_Mandel which opened in 1961 .
